most_active_tickets.title: LTM-2.5 causes Chrome to freeze on large dynamic pages
Pieces has become increasingly slow and is now unresponsive
Workstream activities tab is not working
Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
Bug: unable to cancel the download of an LLLM
🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 12.0.0 Performance and Stability Issues
common_issues.description: Users report performance degradation and instability with Pieces OS 12.0.0 across different operating systems (Windows, macOS, Linux).  Symptoms include Chrome freezing on large webpages with LTM 2.5 enabled, slow or unresponsive "New chats" feature, and application freezing during initialization.  Potential solutions include disabling LTM 2.5, checking LLM model compatibility, and reverting to a previous Pieces OS version.

related_issues.title: LTM-2.5 causes Chrome to freeze on large dynamic pages
related_issues.text:
LTM-2.5 causes Chrome to freeze on large dynamic pages
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When browsing webpages with large amounts of content and dynamic elements, Chrome freezes when Pieces OS with LTM 2.5 is active. 

[Culprit webpage (Clarity CRM API Docs)](https://claritymobileapi.claritycrm.com/Help/Document) is ~500 KB raw HTML, ~700 KB total page size. Dynamic element(s) are a scroll linked table of contents.

**What happens:**

* Chrome CPU usage spikes (~50% CPU) during scrolling.
* Memory usage stays stable.
* Chrome freezes for 10-15 seconds, unfreezes, and freezes again when scrolling resumes.
* Disabling LTM 2.5 resolves the freeze (Pieces OS still running).

**Expected:**
Pieces should handle large pages without freezing or jumping while scrolling.

---

### **Steps to Reproduce**

1. Enable LTM 2.5 in Pieces OS 
2. Load a large page (https://claritymobileapi.claritycrm.com/Help/Document).
3. Scroll through the page.
4. Observe Chrome freeze / become unresponsive as Pieces tries to capture context.
---

### **Environment**

* OS: Windows 11 Pro
* Chrome: 137.0.7151.104
* Pieces OS: 12.0.0
* LTM Version: 2.5
* Pieces Chrome Extension: Tested with and without--same result. 

---

### **Additional Notes**

I observed high-frequency DOM mutations via MutationObserver, but unsure if root cause (found 80-150 DOM mutations per scroll event)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces has become increasingly slow and is now unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces has become increasingly slow and is now unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Version 4.2.0 (4.2.0)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been using Pieces for many months and it has been an absolute timesaver. 

Over the last few weeks, 'New chats' have become increasingly slow, often taking many minutes to get the first response.  This week, it is not responding at all, and failing with the error message: 
"I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app"

I have attempted this with and without LTM enabled and have tried different LLM models - Claude 3.7 Sonnet, Clause 3.5 Sonnect, GPT-4o.    This has not resolved things.

I have independently run the same request with GPT-4o in the browser and the request response is very rapid, so the issue appears to be with the Pieces App, rather than with the LLM
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
related_issues.text:
Doesn't move past Initialising Desktop screen
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi team,

Yesterday (15th June 2025), a new pieces version got released on snap. The new version broke the installation completely and the Desktop application doesn't move past the first step of initialization itself. I thought it was a problem with my system, but I tried a fresh install on a completely different device and same behaviour was observed. Please let me know if there is a way to revert back to the older version till the time this issue gets resolved. Also, please let me know if any further details are required to assist you with the resolution.

Distro: Ubuntu 24.04
Arch: x86_64

Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: LLM Download Cancellation Failure & Initialization Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty canceling LLM downloads on Windows desktops. Additionally, application initialization is failing on Linux (Ubuntu 24.04) after a recent update.  Further investigation is needed to determine the root cause and potential solutions for both issues. Logs and additional system information may be required to reproduce and resolve these problems.

common_issues.title: Workstream Activities and Download Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Workstream activities not syncing correctly after updates, showing outdated information.  Additionally, some experience difficulty canceling LLM downloads.  Check network connectivity, app logs, and ensure the Pieces OS version is up-to-date. Reinstalling the app may also resolve sync issues.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Cloud Service Interruption and Performance Degradation
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing slow performance and unresponsiveness in PiecesOS, Desktop App, and plugins, especially with cloud-connected features like Copilot, Workstream summaries, transforms, and discovery.  A service interruption is being investigated, potentially related to cloud services or a cyber incident.  Data security is not believed to be impacted.  The Pieces team is working on restoring full functionality.

related_issues.title: 🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features
related_issues.text:
🚨 Ongoing Service Interruption Impacting Pieces Products and Cloud-Connected Features
We are currently experiencing a service interruption affecting several cloud-connected features across PiecesOS, the Desktop App, and Pieces Plugins. Specifically, users may notice degraded performance or unresponsiveness in the following areas:

- Copilot responses
- Workstream summaries
- Other cloud-assisted functionalities, such as snippet transforms and snippet discovery

The interruption is tied to unexpected issues with specific cloud services, and we are also actively investigating the possibility of a cyber-related incident as part of our root cause analysis.

We want to reassure all users that your data security and privacy are not impacted. As a precaution, our security and infrastructure teams are treating this with the highest level of urgency and diligence. We are taking all necessary steps to investigate and remediate the issue.

Our engineering and security teams are working around the clock to restore full functionality. We’ll continue to provide updates in this thread as we learn more and make progress.

You can track the status of this interruption here and we’ll notify you once normal service has resumed.

We deeply appreciate your patience and understanding during this time. If you have urgent concerns or need support, please reach out via our usual support channels.

The Pieces Team
No comments found on this issue.

Hi team,

Yesterday (15th June 2025), a new pieces version got released on snap. The new version broke the installation completely and the Desktop application doesn't move past the first step of initialization itself. I thought it was a problem with my system, but I tried a fresh install on a completely different device and same behaviour was observed. recommendations: Prioritize resolving the Pieces OS 12.0.0 performance and stability issues as they affect multiple operating systems and core functionalities like LTM and "New chats".
Investigate and address the LLM download cancellation failure on Windows and the initialization issue on Linux to unblock affected users.
Focus on fixing the Workstream activities sync issue to ensure users have accurate information.
Monitor and address the ongoing service interruption impacting cloud-connected features to restore full functionality.
Improve communication with users regarding the service interruption and provide regular updates on the resolution progress.
Review and update documentation or FAQs regarding LTM 2.5 usage and potential conflicts with large web pages.
Consider implementing a more robust rollback mechanism for Pieces OS updates to mitigate the impact of faulty releases.
Gather more detailed logs and system information from affected users to aid in debugging and resolving issues more efficiently.
Analyze the frequency and impact of different bug categories to identify areas for improvement in the software development process.
Proactively monitor application performance and stability to detect and address potential issues before they escalate and impact a large number of users.
Implement a system for tracking and prioritizing user feedback to ensure that common issues are addressed promptly and effectively.
Investigate the root cause of the "Error generating summary: 404" message appearing in multiple bug reports and address the underlying issue.
Provide support staff with additional training and resources to handle common issues and escalate complex problems to the appropriate development teams.
Develop a more comprehensive testing strategy for new releases to minimize the risk of introducing new bugs or regressions.
Encourage users to submit detailed bug reports with steps to reproduce, environment information, and any relevant error messages to facilitate faster resolution times.
Consider implementing a beta testing program to identify and address potential issues before they are released to the general public.
Regularly review and update support documentation and FAQs to ensure they are accurate and up-to-date.
Implement a system for tracking and analyzing support metrics such as resolution time, customer satisfaction, and common issue trends to identify areas for improvement in support operations.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement in both software development and support operations to enhance the overall user experience.
Explore the possibility of automating certain support tasks, such as initial triage or common issue resolution, to free up support staff to focus on more complex problems.
Consider implementing a user forum or community platform to facilitate peer-to-peer support and knowledge sharing.
Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds to users through various channels, such as in-app notifications, blog posts, or social media updates.
Regularly review and analyze support tickets to identify recurring issues and implement long-term solutions to prevent them from happening again.
Invest in tools and technologies that can help automate and streamline support operations, such as chatbots, ticketing systems, and knowledge bases.
Provide support staff with access to real-time performance data and error logs to enable them to diagnose and resolve issues more quickly.
